NAME: SPANISH_AOA_MEAN
NOTE: Average score of AoA ratings.

NAME: SPANISH_AOA_MIN
NOTE: The minimum age of acquisition indicated by participants.

NAME: SPANISH_AOA_MAX
NOTE: The maximum age of acquisition indicated by participants.

NAME: SPANISH_ORAL_FREQUENCY_LOG
NOTE: Oral frequency norms from Alonso et al. (2011).

NAME: ENGLISH_FREQUENCY
NOTE: The number of times the word appears in the corpus (i.e., on the total of 51 million words).

NAME: ENGLISH_CD
NOTE: The number of films in which the word appears (i.e., it has a maximum value of 8,388).

NAME: ENGLISH_SUBTITLE_FREQUENCY
NOTE: The word frequency per million words. It is the measure one would preferably use in ones manuscripts, because it is a standard measure of word frequency independent of the corpus size. It is given with two-digit precision, in order not to lose precision of the frequency counts.

NAME: ENGLISH_SUBTITLE_CD
NOTE: This  indicates in what percentage of the films the word appears.

NAME: ENGLISH_FREQUENCY_LOG
NOTE: This value is based on log10(FREQcount+1) and has four-digit precision. Calculating the log frequency on the raw frequencies is the most straightforward transformation, because it allows one to give words that are not in the corpus a value of 0. One can easily lose 5% of the variance explained by taking log(frequency per million # 1), because, in this case, one is not making much of a distinction between words with low frequencies. Similarly, adding values lower than 1 (e.g., #1E#10) is dangerous, because one may end up with a big gap between the words in one√ïs corpus and words for which one does not have a frequency measure (which will get a log value of #10). In addition, if one uses log(frequency per million), one will have negative values for words with a frequency lower than 1 per million, and one will have to enter negative values for missing words. The downside of using log10(FREQcount # 1) is that there is no intuitive relationship between Lg10WF and SUBTLWF (frequency per million).

NAME: ENGLISH_CD_LOG
NOTE: This value is based on log10(CDcount+1) and has four-digit precision.

NAME: GERMAN_FREQUENCY
NOTE: This is the number of times the word as written in column 1 is encountered in the subtitle corpus.

NAME: GERMAN_SUBTITLE_FREQUENCY
NOTE: This is the frequency per million based on CUMfreqcount (i.e., it equals CUMfreqcount / 25.399).

NAME: GERMAN_FREQUENCY_LOG
NOTE: This is log10(CUMfreqcount+1). It is the value to use when you want to match stimuli in various conditions. When a stimulus is not present in the corpus, lgSUBTLEX gets a value of 0.

NAME: ENGLISH_CONCRETENESS_MEAN
NOTE: The mean concreteness rating.

NAME: ENGLISH_DUNNO
NOTE: The number of persons indicating they did not know the word.

NAME: ENGLISH_POS
NOTE: The dominant part-of-speech tag of the word.

NAME: ENGLISH_KNOWN_PERCENTAGE
NOTE: The percentages of words known across 220,000 participants.

NAME: ENGLISH_PREVALENCE
NOTE: The word prevalence (number of people who know the word) across 220,000 participants.

NAME: CHINESE_FREQUENCY
NOTE: The number of times the word appears in the corpus.

NAME: CHINESE_FREQUENCY_PM
NOTE: The word frequency per million words. It is the measure one would preferably use in ones manuscripts, because it is a standard measure of word frequency independent of the corpus size. It is given with two-digit precision, in order not to lose precision of the frequency counts.

NAME: CHINESE_FREQUENCY_LOG
NOTE: This value is based on log10(FREQcount+1) and has four-digit precision. Calculating the log frequency on the raw frequencies is the most straightforward transformation, because it allows one to give words that are not in the corpus a value of 0.

NAME: CHINESE_CD
NOTE: The number of films in which the word appears.

NAME: CHINESE_CD_PERCENTAGE
NOTE: This  indicates in what percentage of the films the word appears.

NAME: CHINESE_CD_LOG
NOTE: This value is based on log10(CDcount+1) and has four-digit precision.

NAME: SPANISH_FREQUENCY
NOTE: This is the number of times the word appears in the corpus.

NAME: SPANISH_FREQUENCY_PM
NOTE: Word frequency per million  of subtitles.

NAME: SPANISH_FREQUENCY_LOG
NOTE: Log10 of subtitle word frequency.

NAME: FRENCH_SUBJECTIVE_FREQUENCY
NOTE: Subjective frequencies estimates were based on a 7-point rating scale.

NAME: FRENCH_IMAGEABILITY_MEAN
NOTE: Imageability estimates were based on a 7-point rating scale.

NAME: ENGLISH_HUMOR_MEAN
NOTE: This is the mean value of the ratings on a 5-point scale (1 (humorless) to 5 (humorous)) for all participants.

NAME: ENGLISH_HUMOR_MEAN_MALE
NOTE: This is the mean value of the ratings on a 5-point scale (1 (humorless) to 5 (humorous)) for male participants.

NAME: ENGLISH_HUMOR_MEAN_FEMALE
NOTE: This is the mean value of the ratings on a 5-point scale (1 (humorless) to 5 (humorous)) for female participants.

NAME: ENGLISH_HUMOR_MEAN_YOUNG
NOTE: This is the mean value of the ratings on a 5-point scale (1 (humorless) to 5 (humorous)) for young participants (with age above 32).

NAME: ENGLISH_HUMOR_MEAN_OLD
NOTE: This is the mean value of the ratings on a 5-point scale (1 (humorless) to 5 (humorous)) for old participants (with age under 32).

NAME: ENGLISH_SER_MEAN
NOTE: Sensory experience ratings on a 7-point scale.

NAME: DUTCH_FREQUENCY
NOTE: This is the number of times the word appears in the corpus.

NAME: DUTCH_CD
NOTE: This  is the number of films in which the word appears.

NAME: DUTCH_SUBTITLE_FREQUENCY
NOTE: This is the WF per million words and has 4-digit precision.

NAME: DUTCH_FREQUENCY_LOG
NOTE: This is a value based on log10(FREQcount+1) and with 4-digit precision.

NAME: DUTCH_SUBTITLE_CD
NOTE: This value indicates in what percent of the films the word appears, with 4-digit precision.

NAME: DUTCH_CD_LOG
NOTE: This value is based on log10(CDcount +1) and has 4-digit precision.

NAME: ENGLISH_OCCURRENCES_TOTAL
NOTE: This is the number of valid age of acquisition-ratings of the word.

NAME: ENGLISH_OCCURRENCES_NUM
NOTE: This is the number of valid age of acquisition-ratings of the word, counting only numeric ratings, not 'don't know's.

NAME: ENGLISH_AOA_MEAN
NOTE: This is the mean of the age of acquisition-ratings of the word. A total of 696,048 valid ratings, including 76,211 'don't know's, were collected from 1,729 inhabitants of the US.

NAME: ENGLISH_DUNNO
NOTE: This is the proportion of valid responses that are a rating and not a 'don't know'.

NAME: POLISH_VALENCY_MEAN_MALE
NOTE: This is the mean of the valence ratings for each word obtained in the group of men on a 7-point scale.

NAME: POLISH_VALENCY_MEAN_FEMALE
NOTE: This is the mean of the valence ratings for each word obtained in the group of women on a 7-point scale.

NAME: POLISH_VALENCY_MEAN_ALL
NOTE: This is the mean of the valence ratings for each word obtained in the whole group on a 7-point scale.

NAME: POLISH_AROUSAL_MEAN_MALE
NOTE: This is the mean of the arousal ratings for each word obtained in the group of men on a 5-point scale.

NAME: POLISH_AROUSAL_MEAN_FEMALE
NOTE: This is the mean of the arousal ratings for each word obtained in the group of women on a 5-point scale.

NAME: POLISH_AROUSAL_MEAN_ALL
NOTE: This is the mean of the arousal ratings for each word obtained in the whole group on a 5-point scale.

NAME: POLISH_IMAGEABILITY_MEAN_MALE
NOTE: This is the mean of the imageability ratings for each word obtained in the group of men on a 7-point scale.

NAME: POLISH_IMAGEABILITY_MEAN_FEMALE
NOTE: This is the mean of the imageanility ratings for each word obtained in the group of women on a 7-point scale.

NAME: POLISH_IMAGEABILITY_MEAN_ALL
NOTE: This is the mean of the imageability ratings for each word obtained in the whole group on a 7-point scale.

NAME: ENGLISH_AROUSAL_MEAN
NOTE: Number of Scale Points: 9 Arousal is a measure of excitement versus calmness.

NAME: ENGLISH_VALENCE_MEAN
NOTE: Number of Scale Points: 9 Valence is a measure of value or worth.

NAME: ENGLISH_DOMINANCE_MEAN
NOTE: Number of Scale Points: 9 Dominance is a measure of the degree of control you feel.

NAME: ENGLISH_CONCRETENESS_MEAN
NOTE: Number of Scale Points: 7 Concreteness is a measure of how concrete or abstract something is. A word is CONCRETE if it represents something that exists in a definite physical form in the real world. In contrast, a word is ABSTRACT if it represents more of a concept or idea.

NAME: ENGLISH_IMAGEABILITY_MEAN
NOTE: Number of Scale Points: 7 Imageability is a measure of how easy or difficult something is to imagine.

NAME: ENGLISH_FAMILIARITY_MEAN
NOTE: Number of Scale Points: 7 Familiarity is a measure of how familiar something is.

NAME: ENGLISH_AOA_MEAN
NOTE: Number of Scale Points: 7 A words age of acquisition is the age at which that word was initially learned.

NAME: ENGLISH_SEM_SIZE_MEAN
NOTE: Number of Scale Points: 7 Size is a measure of somethings dimensions, magnitude, or extent. A word represents something BIG if it refers to things or concepts that are large. A word represents something SMALL if it refers to things or concepts that are little.

NAME: ENGLISH_GENDER_ASSOCIATION_MEAN
NOTE: Number of Scale Points: 7 A words gender is how strongly its meaning is associated with male or female behaviour.

NAME: SPANISH_VALENCE_MEAN
NOTE: This is the mean value of valence across all participants. Participants rated the words on a 9-point scale.

NAME: SPANISH_AROUSAL_MEAN
NOTE: This is the mean value of arousal across all participants. Participants rated the words on a 9-point scale.

NAME: SENSES
NOTE: The relations to a sense for a given word.

NOTE: The average standardized RT. Standardized RTs were calculated separately for all levels of participant, block, and lexicality (e.g., all RTs to correct word trials in block 1 by participant 1).

NOTE: The average RT to the stimulus (correct trials only).

NOTE: This is the number of times a translation for a given concept occurs across language families.

NOTE: This is the number of times a translation for a given concept occurs for a given word.

NAME: RANK
NOTE: This is the rank based on the degree.

NOTE: This is the community identifier.

NOTE: This is the most central node in each of the community clusters in CLICS3

NOTE: This is the unweighted and weighted degree for each node.

NOTE: This is the weighted degree for each node across language families.

NAME: WEIGHTED_LANGUAGE_DEGREE
NOTE: This is the weighted degree for each node across language varieties.

NOTE: Mean value for all valid responses on a 7-point scale in the emotional category happiness.

NOTE: Mean value for all valid responses on a 7-point scale in the emotional category anger.

NOTE: Mean value for all valid responses on a 7-point scale in the emotional category sadness.

NOTE: Mean value for all valid responses on a 7-point scale in the emotional category fear.

NAME: POLISH_ANGER_MEAN_FEMALE
NOTE: Mean value for ratings on a 7-point scale in the emotional category anger (only female participants).

NAME: POLISH_SADNESS_MEAN_FEMALE
NOTE: Mean value for ratings on a 7-point scale in the emotional category sadness(only female participants).

NOTE: Mean value for ratings on a 7-point scale in the emotional category fear (only female participants).

NOTE: Mean value for ratings on a 7-point scale in the emotional category happiness (only male participants).

NAME: POLISH_ANGER_MEAN_MALE
NOTE: Mean value for ratings on a 7-point scale in the emotional category anger (only male participants).

NAME: POLISH_SADNESS_MEAN_MALE
NOTE: Mean value for ratings on a 7-point scale in the emotional category sadness(only male participants).

NOTE: Mean value for ratings on a 7-point scale in the emotional category fear (only male participants).

NAME: POLISH_DISGUST_MEAN_MALE

NAME: SPANISH_FREQUENCY
NOTE: This is the number of times the spoken word appears in the corpus.

NAME: SPANISH_FREQUENCY_PM
NOTE: The frequency per million for spoken words.

NAME: SPANISH_FREQUENCY_LOG
NOTE: The log10 of spoken word frequency.

NAME: ENGLISH_AUDITORY_MEAN
NOTE: Auditory strength: mean rating (0‚Äì5) of how strongly the concept is experienced by hearing.

NAME: ENGLISH_GUSTATORY_MEAN
NOTE: Gustatory strength: mean rating (0‚Äì5) of how strongly the concept is experienced by tasting.

NAME: ENGLISH_HAPTIC_MEAN
NOTE: Haptic strength: mean rating (0‚Äì5) of how strongly the concept is experienced by feeling through touch.

NAME: ENGLISH_INTEROCEPTIVE_MEAN
NOTE: Interoceptive strength: mean rating (0‚Äì5) of how strongly the concept is experienced by sensations inside the body.

NAME: ENGLISH_OLFACTORY_MEAN
NOTE: Olfactory strength: mean rating (0‚Äì5) of how strongly the concept is experienced by smelling.

NAME: ENGLISH_VISUAL_MEAN
NOTE: Visual strength: mean rating (0‚Äì5) of how strongly the concept is experienced by seeing.

NAME: ENGLISH_FOOT_ACTION_MEAN
NOTE: Foot action strength: mean rating (0‚Äì5) of how strongly the concept is experienced by performaing an action with the foot / leg.

NAME: ENGLISH_HAND_ACTION_MEAN
NOTE: Hand action strength: mean rating (0‚Äì5) of how strongly the concept is experienced by performaing an action with the hand / arm.

NAME: ENGLISH_HEAD_ACTION_MEAN
NOTE: Head action strength: mean rating (0‚Äì5) of how strongly the concept is experienced by performaing an action with the head excluding mouth.

NAME: ENGLISH_MOUTH_ACTION_MEAN
NOTE: Mouth action strength: mean rating (0‚Äì5) of how strongly the concept is experienced by performaing an action with the mouth / throat.

NAME: ENGLISH_TORSO_ACTION_MEAN
NOTE: Torso action strength: mean rating (0‚Äì5) of how strongly the concept is experienced by performaing an action with the torso.

NAME: ENGLISH_PERCEPTUAL_STRENGTH_MAX
NOTE: Perceptual strength in the dominant modality (i.e., highest strength rating across six perceptual modalities).

NAME: ENGLISH_PERCEPTUAL_STRENGTH_AGGREGATED
NOTE: Aggregated perceptual strength in all modalities where the influence of weaker modalities is attenuated, calculated as Minkowski distance (with exponent 3) of the 6-dimension vector of perceptual strength from the origin.

NAME: ENGLISH_PERCEPTUAL_EXCLUSIVITY
NOTE: Modality exclusivity of the concept; the extent to which a concept is experienced though a single perceptual modality (0‚Äì1, typically expressed as %), calculated as the range of perceptual strength values divided by their sum.

NAME: ENGLISH_PERCEPTUAL_DOMINANT
NOTE: Perceptual modality through which the concept is experienced most strongly (i.e., with highest perceptual strength rating).

NAME: ENGLISH_ACTION_STRENGTH_MAX
NOTE: Action strength in the dominant effector (i.e., highest strength rating across five action effectors).

NAME: ENGLISH_ACTION_STRENGTH_AGGREGATED
NOTE: Aggregated action strength in all effectors where the influence of weaker effectors is attenuated, calculated as Minkowski distance (with exponent 3) of the 5-dimension vector of action strength from the origin.

NAME: ENGLISH_ACTION_EXCLUSIVITY
NOTE: Effector exclusivity of the concept; the extent to which a concept is experienced though a single action effector (0‚Äì1, typically expressed as %), calculated as the range of action strength values divided by their sum‚Ä®.

NAME: ENGLISH_ACTION_DOMINANT
NOTE: Action effector through which the concept is experienced most strongly (i.e., with highest action strength rating).

NAME: ENGLISH_SENSORIMOTOR_STRENGTH_MAX
NOTE: Sensorimotor strength in the dominant dimension (i.e., highest strength rating across 11 sensorimotor dimensions).

NAME: ENGLISH_SENSORIMOTOR_STRENGTH_AGGREGATED
NOTE: Aggregated sensorimotor strength in all dimensions where the influence of weaker dimensions is attenuated, calculated as Minkowski distance (with exponent 3) of the 11-dimension vector of sensorimotor strength from the origin.

NAME: ENGLISH_SENSORIMOTOR_EXCLUSIVITY
NOTE: Sensorimotor exclusivity of the concept; the extent to which a concept is experienced though a single sensorimotor dimension (0‚Äì1, typically expressed as %), calculated as the range of sensorimotor strength values divided by their sum‚Ä®.

NAME: ENGLISH_SENSORIMOTOR_DOMINANT
NOTE: Sensorimotor dimension through which the concept is experienced most strongly (i.e., with highest sensorimotor strength rating).

NAME: ENGLISH_PERCEPTUAL_KNOWN_PERCENTAGE
NOTE: Percentage of participants (0‚Äì1) in perceptual strength norming who knew the concept well enough to provide valid ratings, calculated as N_known.perceptual divided by List_N.perceptual.

NAME: ENGLISH_ACTION_KNOWN_PERCENTAGE
NOTE: Percentage of participants (0‚Äì1) in action strength norming who knew the concept well enough to provide valid ratings, calculated as N_known.action divided by List_N.action.

NAME: ENGLISH_PERCEPTUAL_AOA_MEAN
NOTE: Average age of participants in perceptual strength norming who completed the item list featuring the concept (i.e., who were presented with the concept for rating).

NAME: ENGLISH_ACTION_AOA_MEAN
NOTE: Average age of participants in action strength norming who completed the item list featuring the concept (i.e., who were presented with the concept for rating).

NAME: TURKISH_VALENCE_MEAN
NOTE: Mean value for all valid responses on a 9-point Likert SAM scale for valence.

NAME: TURKISH_AROUSAL_MEAN
NOTE: Mean value for all valid responses on a 9-point Likert SAM for arousal.

NAME: TURKISH_HAPPINESS_MEAN
NOTE: Mean value for all valid responses on a scale ranging from 0 (low intensity) to 100 (strong intensity) for the emotional category happiness.

NAME: TURKISH_ANGER_MEAN
NOTE: Mean value for all valid responses on a scale ranging from 0 (low intensity) to 100 (strong intensity) for the emotional category anger.

NAME: TURKISH_SADNESS_MEAN
NOTE: Mean value for all valid responses on a scale ranging from 0 (low intensity) to 100 (strong intensity) for the emotional category sadness.

NAME: TURKISH_FEAR_MEAN
NOTE: Mean value for all valid responses on a scale ranging from 0 (low intensity) to 100 (strong intensity) for the emotional category fear.

NAME: TURKISH_DISGUST_MEAN
NOTE: Mean value for all valid responses on a scale ranging from 0 (low intensity) to 100 (strong intensity) for the emotional category disgust.

NAME: TURKISH_CONCRETENESS_MEAN
NOTE: Mean value for all valid responses on a scale ranging from 0 (low intensity) to 100 (strong intensity) for concreteness.
